310670.description: Ripe aromas of honeydew, mango and slight banana show on the nose of this bottling, which retains its freshness deep into the sipping experience. There is a strong chalky grip to the sip, where ripe tropical flavors of papaya and coconut flake are cut by clean lines of citrus peel.
310670.title: Monochrome 2017 Plum Orchard Lane Vineyard Albariño (Paso Robles)
310670.location: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
310670.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

310744.description: Steely in acidity, this white has a fleshy midpalate of apricot with floral underpinnings of jasmine and rose. A moderate body of texture is layered and refreshingly crisp.
310744.title: Thirty-Seven 2016 Albariño (Sonoma Coast)
310744.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Contributing Editor Virginie Boone has been with Wine Enthusiast since 2010, and reviews the wines of Napa and Sonoma. Boone began her writing career with Lonely Planet travel guides, which eventually led to California-focused wine coverage. She contributes to the Santa Rosa Press Democrat and Sonoma Magazine, and is a regular panelist and speaker on wine topics in California and beyond.

 Email: vboone@wineenthusiast.net.

304993.description: Entirely fresh aromas of apple and honeydew rank as pure and inviting. On the palate, this is buffed and stony, like a good Rías Baixas Albariño should be. Nectarine and citrus flavors finish well on a long, effortless finish.
304993.title: Bodegas Aquitania 2017 Bernon Albariño (Rías Baixas)
304993.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.
Michael Schachner is a New York-based journalist specializing in wine, food and travel. His articles appear regularly in Wine Enthusiast, where he is a longstanding contributing editor responsible for South America and Spain. Schachner reviews more than 2,000 wines annually for WE and regularly travels to Chile, Argentina and Spain to keep abreast of the constantly changing global wine map.

Email: mschachner@wineenthusiast.net.

306615.description: Floral melon and apple aromas come with a hint of lees-driven vanilla cookie. A pulpy palate deals tropical fruit and stone fruit flavors, while this Albariño is firm in feel and slightly salty tasting on a lasting finish.
306615.title: Bodegas Carsalo 2017 Pazo Castrelo Albariño (Rías Baixas)

305398.description: Citrus and tropical fruit aromas are punchy and high toned. A lemony palate is softened by leesy notes, while this tastes dry and of lean white fruit and white pepper. A tight finish is focused but not all that fruity or flavorful.
305398.title: Granbazán 2017 Etiqueta Verde Albariño (Rías Baixas)

302822.description: A mineral-driven nose includes oceanic notes of sea brine to go with apple and light oak scents. Sizzling acidity is in the green-apple realm, while this Albariño tastes of Granny Smith apple, gooseberry, oak and lees. A tangy, pinched finish is salty and firm.
302822.title: La Caña 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
302822.taster_description:

301912.description: Plump, leesy aromas of melon and peach are varietally on par. A round palate shows balance and proper acidity, while salty, briny, dusty white fruit flavors are leesy and suggest melon and nectarine on the finish.
301912.title: Montecillo 2017 Singladuras Albariño (Rías Baixas)
301912.taster_description:

304020.description: Apple and talcum powder aromas are normal for Albariño. A plump palate is balanced by citric acidity, while this tastes of apple and briny citrus prior to a finish that's showing a slight hint of pyrazine-based green.
304020.title: Valdemonxes 2017 Clásico Albariño (Rías Baixas)

305396.description: There's no mistaking the main ingredient in this barrel-driven Albariño, and that's Limousin oak, which gives off extreme aromas of wood grain and turpentine. A plump palate is chunky due to barrel aging, while this tastes mostly of wood resin and related bitterness. While well made, this is what it is: a heavily oaked Albariño cut from its own mold.
305396.title: Granbazán 2015 Limousin Albariño (Rías Baixas)
305396.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.

304221.description: This wine is quiet on the nose, with notes of matchstick and underripe fruit. Bitterness and a lack of fruit carry over to a finish that's lacking in precision.
304221.title: Burgáns 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
304221.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.

307575.description: Clean and tight on the nose, this bottling offers lemon juice, chalk, wet river stone and sharp, grassy aromas. There is great acidity and strong tension to the palate that grabs the tongue and won't let go, weaving through flavors of lemon-lime and Anjou pear.
307575.title: Crū 2017 Albariño (Edna Valley)
307575.location: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
307575.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

307593.description: Tightly woven aromas of chalky mandarin zest and faint nectarine show on the fresh nose of this bottling by Rick Longoria. There is bright lemony flavor and crushed chalk minerality on the palate, and the acid just won't quit, even days after opening the bottle.
307593.title: Longoria 2017 Clover Creek Vineyard Albariño (Santa Ynez Valley)
307593.location: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
307593.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

302965.description: Fresh while also creamy, this wine is full of ripe apple fruits cut with lemon zest. It is a young wine with rich potential and a strong texture. Let the forward fruitiness calm down and drink from 2019.
302965.title: Quinta de Paços 2017 Casa do Capitão-Mor Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
302965.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

302982.description: Lightly herbal, this crisp, cool wine is also rich with pear and melon flavors. The acidity and mineral edge give it an extra attractiveness. The wine is still a little young, so wait until mid-2019.
302982.title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2017 Alvarinho (Tejo)
302982.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

305971.description: The alcohol is down significantly in 2017, but flavors remain generic. There's light apple fruit with a hint of citrus, but it's just a generic white wine at the end of the day.
305971.title: Schmidt 2017 Albariño (Applegate Valley)
305971.location: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
305971.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Oregon and Canada.
Paul Gregutt is a Contributing Editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine, a founding member of the magazine’s Tasting Panel, and reviews the wines of Oregon and Canada. The author of the critically-acclaimed Washington Wines & Wineries—The Essential Guide, he consulted on the Pacific Northwest entries in current versions of The World Atlas of Wine and The Oxford Companion to Wine.
Email: paulgwine@me.com.

299783.description: Orange and blanched almond aromas are light and lucid on the nose. This is citrusy and ripe on the palate but not heavy. Citrus and melon flavors are a touch leesy, while this is steady and well-balanced fresh, rounded finish.
299783.title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2017 Esencia Diviña Albariño (Rías Baixas)
299783.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.

300992.description: Racy orange peel and melon aromas set the stage for a well-formed palate with good acidity, freshness and balance. Lightly briny white fruit flavors are textbook for Albariño, while a note of green herbs rises up on a popping finish. The track record for this label is good to excellent; this adheres to precedent.
300992.title: Val do Sosego 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
300992.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.

298598.title: Bodegas Muriel 2017 Pazo Cilleiro Albariño (Rías Baixas)

300950.description: Apple and peach aromas along with stony minerality render the nose legitimate. This feels lemony and correct. Green apple, stone fruit and a dash of salt are the flavors, while this shows mild to medium acidity throughout.
300950.title: Camino de Cabras 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

297939.title: Bodegas Eidosela 2017 Ethereo Albariño (Rías Baixas)

298489.description: A jumpy, high-toned nose deals a mix of fresh white fruit scents, floral notes and a whiff of citrus oil. The palate is popping with acidity but holds on to some roundness. Dry, peachy flavors are a bit salty, while this tastes melony on a short finish.
298489.title: Viña Ludy 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

296549.description: Light citrus, peach and buttercup aromas are appealing and easygoing. A plump palate with citric acidity is round and healthy, while this tastes of citrus and tropical fruit. This is steady on the finish; drink now.
296549.title: Lagar de Indra 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

294997.title: As Laxas 2017 Vieira de Plata Albariño (Rías Baixas)

301206.title: Balderdash 2016 Truth Serum Albariño (Edna Valley)
301206.location: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US

301089.description: Melon and mild pyrazine-based green aromas create a good but slightly unfocused nose. This feels chunky and pulpy, with melony weight. Flavors of pineapple and nectarine are briny on the back end, while this is short on a finish that's low on acidic verve.
301089.title: Fillaboa 2017 Estate Grown Albariño (Rías Baixas)
301089.taster_description:

276033.description: The citrusy nose shows fresh quince, apricot, orange peels and bitter lemon. The fruit flavors are ripe on the palate due to soft acidity, offering bitter citrus, peach and orange. There is a touch of white pepper on the midpalate, ending with notes of clementine and lime pith.
276033.title: McPherson 2016 Castaño Prado Vineyards Albariño (Texas)
276033.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Other U.S.
Fiona Adams’ excitement for wine was sparked at a young age by her father. Working in a handful of New York City wine shops and a stint in Long Island wine country, she developed her wine knowledge, eventually earning her Level 2 WSET certification. Joining Wine Enthusiast in 2014, Fiona hopes to share her passion for natural wines.
Email: fadams@wineenthusiast.net

298593.description: Yeasty melon, hand soap and geranium petal aromas lead to a chunky palate that's a bit soft and overweight. Flavors of briny citrus, green herb and peach pit do their best to hold up on the finish. Drink now.
298593.title: Pazo de Barrantes 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
298593.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.

The palate has a creamy mouthfeel, rounding out flavors of lemonade, white peach juice, lemon balm and gooseberry. The orange oil finish has a faint bitter lime edge.
273740.title: Pedernales 2015 Albariño (Texas)
273740.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Other U.S.
Fiona Adams’ excitement for wine was sparked at a young age by her father. Working in a handful of New York City wine shops and a stint in Long Island wine country, she developed her wine knowledge, eventually earning her Level 2 WSET certification. 302440.description: Richly endowed, this full, perfumed wine celebrates 20 years since this estate first bottled wine. With ripe apples balanced by fine citrus acidity, the wine is both rich and tensely crisp. Drink from 2019.
302440.title: Casa do Valle 2017 Grande Escolha Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
302440.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. 302262.description: Pleasing aromas of pear, melon and banana chips are followed by pure fruit flavors with a rounded feel. It brings a pleasing snap of acidity on the banana-filled finish.
302262.title: Coyote Canyon 2017 Albariño (Horse Heaven Hills)
302262.location: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
302262.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Washington and Idaho
In addition to his work at Wine Enthusiast, Sean P. Sullivan is the founder of Washington Wine Report, a site dedicated to the wines and wineries of the Pacific Northwest that has twice been named ‘Best Single Subject Wine Blog’ by the Wine Blog Awards. Sullivan has authored over 100 print articles on Northwest wine. He resides in Seattle, Washington.
Email: ssullivan@wineenthusiast.net.

294162.description: Citrus and mineral aromas are clean and proper for top-level Albariño from Rías Baixas. A lean tangy citric palate is exact and stony in feel. Lemon-lime and green-apple flavors are tight and tart, while this remains lively and tart on an acid-driven finish.
294162.title: Mar de Frades 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
294162.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.

300507.description: This wine comes from the Monção and Melgaço region in the north of Vinho Verde, the spiritual home of Alvarinho. It has all the richness associated with the grape, with a strong layer of minerality as well as a zesty texture. Apples and green plums come through the young acidity. This will be better from 2019.
300507.title: J. Portugal Ramos 2017 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
300507.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

298549.description: Zesty aromas of lime give an edge to the warmer tones of poached pear and peach on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with a lemon sorbet and tangerine-rind kick before tasting much like orange juice, with a flash of hazelnut on the finish.
298549.title: Bodega de Edgar 2017 Paso Ono Vineyard Albariño (Paso Robles)
298549.location: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
298549.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival.

296316.description: Attractively buttery in flavor and very creamy in texture, this medium- to full-bodied wine tastes like vanilla, butterscotch and honey, and feels smooth and almost thick on the palate. Not the usual tangy profile of the varietal, but it's done well in an über-rich style.
296316.title: Wilson Foreigner 2017 Rorick Vineyard Albariño (Sierra Foothills)
296316.location: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
296316.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Jim Gordon has been covering the wine industry as an editor and reporter for more than 30 years. In 2006 he became editor of Wines & Vines, the media company for North American winemakers and grape growers. He directs the editorial content of Wines & Vines in the monthly print magazine, digital and social media. Gordon is also a contributing editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine and past director of the annual Symposium for Professional Wine Writers at Meadowood Napa Valley. He was editor in chief for two books by publisher Dorling Kindersley of London: Opus Vino, and 1000 Great Everyday Wines. Gordon was managing editor of Wine Spectator for 12 years, and editor in chief of Wine Country Living magazine for four, during which time he helped create Wine Country Living TV for NBC station KNTV in San Jose. He lives in Napa, California. Email: jgordon@wineenthusiast.net.

295797.description: Aromas of lanolin, orange and green melon are perfectly sound. This has a plump but citrusy mouthfeel and snappy flavors of orange and fresh lettuce. Keep your expectations reasonable and this is more than just good: it's actually very good, especially for the price.
295797.title: Vionta 2017 Limited Release Albariño (Rías Baixas)

Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.

294281.title: Mar de Viñas 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

298955.title: Stasis 2017 Albariño (Edna Valley)

294280.title: Nessa 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
294280.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.
Michael Schachner is a New York-based journalist specializing in wine, food and travel. His articles appear regularly in Wine Enthusiast, where he is a longstanding contributing editor responsible for South America and Spain. Schachner reviews more than 2,000 wines annually for WE and regularly travels to Chile, Argentina and Spain to keep abreast of the constantly changing global wine map.

Email: mschachner@wineenthusiast.net.

300371.description: This wine comes from outside the heartland of Alvarinho, in southern Vinho Verde, hence the Minho appellation. It is rich and full of ripe fruits, with an open, tangy texture. Already deliciously fruity, the wine will be better from 2019.
300371.title: Quinta das Arcas 2017 Arca Nova Alvarinho (Minho)
300371.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

298557.description: Very light and clean aromas of lime balm, squeezed citrus, freshly cut apple and wet cement show on the nose of this bottling from Spanish Springs Vineyard. Green-pear and sliced apple flavors are framed by a chalky grip and a racy acidity that's almost too powerful.
298557.title: Croma Vera 2017 Albariño (San Luis Obispo County)
298557.location: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
298557.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

300136.description: Fruit for this wine comes from Dutchman Vineyard. The aromas pop, with notes of lemon rind and melon leading to lightly spritzy ale, pineapple-rind and melon flavors. It appears to need some additional time in bottle to settle in.
300136.title: The Orcas Project 2017 Dutchman Vineyard Albariño (Yakima Valley)
300136.location: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
300136.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Washington and Idaho
In addition to his work at Wine Enthusiast, Sean P. Sullivan is the founder of Washington Wine Report, a site dedicated to the wines and wineries of the Pacific Northwest that has twice been named ‘Best Single Subject Wine Blog’ by the Wine Blog Awards. Sullivan has authored over 100 print articles on Northwest wine. He resides in Seattle, Washington.
Email: ssullivan@wineenthusiast.net.

300461.description: Plenty of acidity reminds us that this grape's home is in the cool north of Portugal. A touch of richness and tropical fruit helps bring this wine south. It's attractive, balanced and ready to drink.
300461.title: Casa Santos Lima 2017 Alvarinho (Lisboa)
300461.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

295152.description: Aromas of yeasty citrus, fresh corn and lanolin announce a softer, warmer-climate Albariño than what most fans of the grape are used to. A solid but bland palate lacks lift and snap but isn't flabby. Peachy yeasty flavors are limited through the finish but never problematic.
295152.title: Raimat 2017 Saira Albariño (Costers del Segre)
295152.taster_description:

Michael Schachner is a New York-based journalist specializing in wine, food and travel. His articles appear regularly in Wine Enthusiast, where he is a longstanding contributing editor responsible for South America and Spain. Schachner reviews more than 2,000 wines annually for WE and regularly travels to Chile, Argentina and Spain to keep abreast of the constantly changing global wine map.

300551.designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Maria Bonita
300551.title: Wines & Winemakers 2017 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Maria Bonita Alvarinho (Minho)
300551.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

300298.description: In the warm climate of Tejo, the northern grape Alvarinho becomes rich, full of creamy apple fruits that are shot through with citrus acidity. This is a balanced wine already and can be drunk now.
300298.title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2017 Vudu Alvarinho (Tejo)
300298.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

300549.description: This is a soft wine, surprisingly so considering the grape and its origins in northern Vinho Verde. It has fruit but it does seem to miss out on flavor and definition.
300549.designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Maria Papoila
300549.title: Wines & Winemakers 2017 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Maria Papoila Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
300549.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

295550.description: Get past the seriously tall bottle (that doesn't fit in any fridge door) and this wine is a whole new view of Alvarinho. Wood aged and ripe with spice and smooth white fruits, the wine is intense and beautifully ripe. It should be aged a little longer to bring out its full character, so drink from early 2019.
295550.title: Anselmo Mendes 2017 Muros de Melgaço Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
295550.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

295551.description: With some bottle age, this is a rich wine from the Monção and Melgaço sub-region of Vinho Verde. That's the home of Alvarinho and the cool damp climate on granite soil suits this grape perfectly. Spicy, tangy and with a toasty edge from wood aging, the wine is intense, ripe and with a final tight, mineral texture and acidity. Drink now.
295551.title: Anselmo Mendes 2016 Expressões Colheita Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
295551.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

295553.description: Lees aged for four months, this young crisp wine also has density and concentration. Pure Alvarinho gives the wine its distinctive mineral and cream character, along with hints of yellow fruits as well as apples. This is an impressive, still young wine, so drink from 2019.
295553.title: Anselmo Mendes 2017 Contacto Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
295553.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

295153.description: Wood-aged Alvarinho from the northern Vinho Verde, this is lightly spicy and definitely rich. It has fine acidity, giving a cool feel and a zingy texture. This is a poised wine ready to drink now.
295153.title: Provam 2016 Vinha Antiga Escolha Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
295153.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

295469.description: Named after the chameleons that skitter throughout the region in the summer, this wine is a creamy, fruity take on Alvarinho. It has a crisp texture, apple fruits and tight mineral acidity. It will be better with some more bottle age, so drink from 2019.
295469.title: João Cabral Almeida 2017 Camaleão Alvarinho (Minho)
295469.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

295485.description: A ripe and smoothly textured wine, this Alvarinho is lemon and apple flavored, warm and aromatic. It is still young, with bright fruit that needs to soften a little. Let this wine age a few more months and drink from 2019.
295485.title: Quinta de Curvos 2017 Curvos Alvarinho (Minho)
295485.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

296955.description: Aromas of freshly cut pear, white flowers, citrus and sweet herbs are followed by white and pink-grapefruit flavors. A tart lingering finish caps it off with a bright impression.
296955.title: Maryhill 2017 Proprietor's Reserve Otis Vineyard Albariño (Columbia Valley (WA))
296955.location: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
296955.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Washington and Idaho
In addition to his work at Wine Enthusiast, Sean P. Sullivan is the founder of Washington Wine Report, a site dedicated to the wines and wineries of the Pacific Northwest that has twice been named ‘Best Single Subject Wine Blog’ by the Wine Blog Awards. Sullivan has authored over 100 print articles on Northwest wine. He resides in Seattle, Washington.
Email: ssullivan@wineenthusiast.net.

296112.description: Pleasant aromas of cut grass, aloe and grapefruit are abundant on the nose. More lush aloe shows on the palate with a dash of salt. This is medium in weight, with balanced acidity and finishes soft and flavorful.
296112.title: Horton 2017 Private Release Albariño (Virginia)
296112.taster_description:
Joining Wine Enthusiast in 2015, Carrie’s love of wine and thirst for knowledge is immediately recognizable, and her superior organizational skills keeps our in-house tastings organized and efficient. When not putting flights together, she’s contributing content to the print magazine and Web site.
Email: cdykes@wineenthusiast.net

295103.description: From the Minho region in northern Portugal, the wine is ripe, with citrus and white-fruit flavors and is already ready to drink. Balanced between acidity and a more rounded texture, the wine is both fruity and generous. Drink now.
295103.title: Luis Duarte 2017 Maravista Alvarinho (Minho)
295103.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

292711.description: Rich with a creamy texture, this is a full-bodied wine, highlighting one of the top grapes of the region. It is juicy—full of both citrus and crisp apple fruits—zesty and tangy and with great acidity at the end. Drink this wine from 2019.
292711.title: Quinta da Raza 2017 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Alvarinho (Minho)
292711.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

295436.description: The wine comes from vineyards close to the Atlantic coast in the western Alentejo. While it bears little resemblance to the Alvarinho of northern Portugal, it has acquired richness, tropical fruit flavors as well as retaining plenty of crisp acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
295436.title: Cortes de Cima 2016 Alvarinho (Alentejano)
295436.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

292718.description: The packaging, which involves an immensely tall bottle, is certainly impressive. The wine doesn't quite live up to the bottle. It is a spicy wine with a creamy texture and crisp acidity at the end. Drink the wine now.
292718.title: Quinta das Arcas 2016 Conde Vilar Alvarinho (Minho)
292718.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. 295757.description: This is a ripe style of Alvarinho that brings out tropical fruit flavors as well as apple acidity and produces a wine that is smooth and ripe. There is a fine edge of acidity that adds citrus juice, leaving a crisp texture at the end. Drink the wine from 2019.
295757.title: Casa de Vila Verde 2017 Pluma Alvarinho (Minho)
295757.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. 294036.description: Lemon curd and pineapple aromas are melded together with wet stone and white peach in this Albariño. The flavors are tropical and savory with a salty aftertaste. Medium in body and acidity, the finish follows suit and ends on an overripe note.
294036.title: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Wessex Hundred Albariño (Virginia)
294036.taster_description:
Joining Wine Enthusiast in 2015, Carrie’s love of wine and thirst for knowledge is immediately recognizable, and her superior organizational skills keeps our in-house tastings organized and efficient. When not putting flights together, she’s contributing content to the print magazine and Web site.
Email: cdykes@wineenthusiast.net

293058.description: Loads of cut pear, yellow apple rinds, dried lime skins and wet cement show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate rides a racy line of acidity and chalky texture to deliver flavors of red apple and Anjou pear.
293058.title: Joyce 2017 Cedar Lane Albariño (Arroyo Seco)
293058.location: Arroyo Seco, Central Coast, California, US
293058.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

293172.description: There's a very intriguing and inviting Asian pear extract element on the nose of this bottling, along with wet gravel, yellow melon and a barely ripe kiwi aromas. Light and bright flavors pop on the palate, from lemon rinds and grapefruit juice to rainy sidewalk, all wrapped in a very grippy texture.
293172.title: Morgan 2017 Albariño (Monterey)
293172.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. 294893.description: Tangy lime-skin aromas meet with yellow pear flesh and a touch of honey on the nose of this bottling, which gains nuance from the acacia wood treatment. There is grippy texture on the palate, where citrus acidity cuts through the Pink Lady apple flavors.
294893.title: Brecon Estate 2017 True Acacia Head Albariño (Central Coast)
294893.location: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
294893.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. 295344.description: The producer's first vintage of this white, this shows medium-bodied ripeness and texture, nearly no oak, and strong aromas and flavors of green apple and mango. It's a fine wine for the table, picnic basket or front porch with friends.
295344.title: Picayune 2017 Rusty Gate Farm Albariño (Russian River Valley)
295344.location: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
295344.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Contributing Editor Virginie Boone has been with Wine Enthusiast since 2010, and reviews the wines of Napa and Sonoma. Boone began her writing career with Lonely Planet travel guides, which eventually led to California-focused wine coverage. She contributes to the Santa Rosa Press Democrat and Sonoma Magazine, and is a regular panelist and speaker on wine topics in California and beyond.

 Email: vboone@wineenthusiast.net.

293533.description: This wine's pineapple and floral aromas are blowsy at first but settle with airing. Its smooth palate has a full texture, bracing acidity and lightly salty apple flavors that finish with a briny note of seashell. Overall, this balances pop with weight, capturing what can be so appealing about Albariño.
293533.title: Adegas Tollodouro 2017 Blanquito Albariño (Rías Baixas)
293533.taster_description:

293048.description: Honey, lemon blossom and white-peach aromas show on the tightly wound nose of this Albariño, which fares well in the warmer Southern California climate. Bright acidity carries flavors of wet stone, edgy citrus and green pear on the palate.

292948.description: Fresh peach in a bowl describes how this nicely made Albariño smells. Its round, full-bodied palate is balanced with acidity. And its fresh peach and apricot flavors lead to a chalky, minerally finish.
292948.title: Columna 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

293539.title: Condes de Albarei 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

293512.title: Forjas del Salnés 2017 Leirana Albariño (Rías Baixas)

294984.title: Tangent 2016 Stone Egg Paragon Vineyard Albariño (Edna Valley)
294984.location: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US

293571.title: Serra da Estrela 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

293497.title: Pazo San Mauro 2017 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

293531.title: Altos de Torona 2017 Torre de Ermelo Albariño (Rías Baixas)

292707.title: Quinta da Lixa 2015 Reserva Alvarinho (Minho)

292653.description: Made from grapes sourced in Moncão and Melgaço, at the northern frontier of Portugal, this wine is rich with creamed apple character and rounded, full texture. Generous and ripe, it could age another few months. Drink from 2019.
292653.title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Barca 2017 Estreia Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

292703.description: Typically creamy yet also crisply fruity, this rounded wine is shot through with tight acidity. It has delicious fruitiness, a touch of minerality and youthful freshness. Hold off drinking this wine until 2019.
292703.title: Quinta da Lixa 2017 Pouco Comum Alvarinho (Minho)
292703.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

292697.description: This wine expresses both the terroir of the estate and the Alvarinho grape, with a rich, dense texture, fine acidity and minerality. It has a warm, creamy edge that contrasts with its acidity. Drink now.
292697.title: Quinta da Calçada 2016 Terroir Alvarinho (Minho)
292697.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. 291833.description: This wine's dusty lemon and straw aromas lead to a medium-bodied, creamy palate with healthy acidity. Its quick-hitting apple and grass flavors finish fresh but short, without much complexity. Enjoy now with summery fare.
291833.title: As Laxas 2017 Laxas Albariño (Rías Baixas)
291833.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.
Michael Schachner is a New York-based journalist specializing in wine, food and travel. His articles appear regularly in Wine Enthusiast, where he is a longstanding contributing editor responsible for South America and Spain. 292830.description: This Albariño, the vines for which were planted specifically for the winery, has high-toned orange oil, melon rind and tangerine aromas. It's richly flavorful, with abundant tangerine flavors and ale notes on the finish that might integrate with time. It intrigues.
292830.title: Adamant Cellars 2017 Gateshead Vineyard Albariño (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
292830.location: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
292830.taster_description:

In addition to his work at Wine Enthusiast, Sean P. Sullivan is the founder of Washington Wine Report, a site dedicated to the wines and wineries of the Pacific Northwest that has twice been named ‘Best Single Subject Wine Blog’ by the Wine Blog Awards. Sullivan has authored over 100 print articles on Northwest wine. He resides in Seattle, Washington.
Email: ssullivan@wineenthusiast.net.

287110.description: This dramatic wine is no wallflower. It has a bright light-yellow color, striking aromas of chicken stock and wet earth that contrast with the tangy white-peach and grapefruit flavors that follow. It's very light in alcohol but feels medium bodied.

287110.taster_description:

289469.title: Per Caso 2015 Albariño (Edna Valley)
289469.location: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
289469.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

288923.description: Citrus aromas are forceful and show a hint of green bell pepper. A plump melony palate is healthy and easygoing. Briny green-melon flavors are modest on a finish that indicates that it's time to drink this.

There is great grip to the palate as well as a light texture, but the flavors are generous with more stone fruit and melon, making it rounded and likable for many tastes.

283038.description: The nose on this ultimately zesty wine starts off on the richer side, with baked apple, yellow melon, cherimoya and orange peel. On the palate, the acidity is immediate and tremendously persistent, with flavors of apple blossom, pear syrup and tangerine spray riding the chalky texture.

283038.location: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
283038.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.

283051.description: Plump aromas of poached pear, Meyer lemon pith, honeysuckle and an underlying slate-like minerality hit the nose on this bottling. There's a roundness to the palate of Asian pear, but the sip is all about grippy texture and sizzling citrus energy that carries deep into the finish.
283051.title: Longoria 2016 Clover Creek Vineyard Albariño (Santa Ynez Valley)
283051.location: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US

278852.description: Minerally aromas are balanced by light, elegant fruit scents akin to applesauce and pear. This feels refined on a palate that's only slightly pulpy. A fruit-bowl's worth of stylish citrus and apple flavors are lasting on the finish. Drink now.
278852.title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2016 Esencia Diviña Albariño (Rías Baixas)

278854.description: Melony aromas are leesy and a touch rich and flat. That's also how the palate comes across. Inexact nectarine flavors are plump and turn slightly bitter and yeasty on the finish. It's best to drink this right away.
278854.title: Adegas Gran Vinum 2016 Selección Especial Albariño (Rías Baixas)

Piercing acidity keeps things in balance, while oxidized flavors of corn and salted peach finish strong and slightly bitter. This unique style of Albariño is not for everyone.

284473.description: The winery's white wines are extraordinarily high in alcohol, which inevitably blows out any subtleties and varietal character. This is thick, fruity, almost syrupy, with principal flavors of canned peaches.
284473.title: Schmidt 2016 Albariño (Applegate Valley)
284473.location: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
284473.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Oregon and Canada.
Paul Gregutt is a Contributing Editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine, a founding member of the magazine’s Tasting Panel, and reviews the wines of Oregon and Canada. The author of the critically-acclaimed Washington Wines & Wineries—The Essential Guide, he consulted on the Pacific Northwest entries in current versions of The World Atlas of Wine and The Oxford Companion to Wine.
Email: paulgwine@me.com.

280917.description: Combining both citrus pith and more tropical components, this bottling shows fresh melon, Key lime, light guava and a touch of passion fruit on the nose. It tightens up on the palate, with sour orange and lime-sprayed popcorn flavors.
280917.title: Pear Valley 2016 Pear Valley Vineyard Albariño (Paso Robles)
280917.location: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

277745.description: Pear and grapefruit aromas are prominent on the clean and easy nose of this bottling from Spanish Springs Vineyard, as is a sweet floral touch of Stargazer lily. The flavors are crisp and strong with more white flowers, and the grippy chalky texture and solid acidity make for a lovely wine altogether.
277745.title: Croma Vera 2016 Albariño (San Luis Obispo County)
277745.location: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US

272427.description: Full bodied and full flavored, this substantial wine combines intense fruit flavors with bold, buttery and spicy accents. It feels mouthfilling and rich but has enough good acidity for liveliness and balance. Fine print on the label says this is made from Albariño, and it's a most unusual and enjoyable example of the Spanish varietal.
272427.title: Monochrome 2016 Barrel Distortion Albariño (California)
272427.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Jim Gordon has been covering the wine industry as an editor and reporter for more than 30 years. In 2006 he became editor of Wines & Vines, the media company for North American winemakers and grape growers. He directs the editorial content of Wines & Vines in the monthly print magazine, digital and social media. Gordon is also a contributing editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine and past director of the annual Symposium for Professional Wine Writers at Meadowood Napa Valley. He was editor in chief for two books by publisher Dorling Kindersley of London: Opus Vino, and 1000 Great Everyday Wines. Gordon was managing editor of Wine Spectator for 12 years, and editor in chief of Wine Country Living magazine for four, during which time he helped create Wine Country Living TV for NBC station KNTV in San Jose. He lives in Napa, California. Email: jgordon@wineenthusiast.net.

273431.description: In this vintage, the wine itself is as catchy as Mar de Frades's signature blue bottle. Aromas of green melon, apple and lees are spot on for the variety. Flavors of pineapple and citrus finish with modest complexity carried by the presence of lees.
273431.title: Mar de Frades 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
273431.taster_description:

275822.title: Martín Códax 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

Contributing Editor Virginie Boone has been with Wine Enthusiast since 2010, and reviews the wines of Napa and Sonoma. 277082.description: This 100% Alvarinho comes from the grape's heartland in the north of the Vinho Verde region. It is crisp while also having concentrated green and citrus fruits, a rich mineral texture and layers of beautifully refreshing acidity. Drink this wine from 2018.
277082.title: Santos & Seixo 2016 Santos da Casa Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
277082.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

276887.description: A barrel-aged Alvarinho, but one that is so delicately toasty that the fruit is what this ripe generous wine is all about. It is rich with citrus and pear flavors, zesty and tangy while also having room for a round ripe aftertaste. This is an impressive wine, ready to drink now.
276887.title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
276887.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. Its citrus is balanced by white peach and green-plum flavors. The finish adds an orange-zest tang that is both refreshing and gives a tight texture. Drink now.

It is full of citrus, ripe lemon and lime along with a crisp mineral texture. Its acidity is both tense and refreshing, allowing the wine a chance to age. Drink from 2018.

276886.description: Alvarinho from the northern Vinho Verde region lends itself to bubbles with its naturally crisp character. It gives a wine that has a tight mineral texture that lifts the citrus and green-apple fruits. The wine, packed with acidity, is ready to drink.
276886.title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Reserva Bruto Natural Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
276886.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

276876.description: Away from its native vineyard in the north of Portugal, the Alvarinho becomes extra rich and ripe in the hot center. That's the case here with a soft wine that has apple and pear flavors. It is light on the acidity, always fruity and easy to drink with food. Drink now.
276876.title: Herdade das Servas 2016 Alvarinho (Alentejano)
276876.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

265283.description: The nose carries notes of honeydew and papaya. This tropical feel continues on the palate, with flavors of overripe pear and melon. This is an easy-drinking wine, light in acidity and body, with a mildly fruity finish.
265283.title: Horton 2016 Private Reserve Albariño (Virginia)
265283.taster_description:
Joining Wine Enthusiast in 2015, Carrie’s love of wine and thirst for knowledge is immediately recognizable, and her superior organizational skills keeps our in-house tastings organized and efficient. When not putting flights together, she’s contributing content to the print magazine and Web site.
Email: cdykes@wineenthusiast.net

272640.description: Just a single barrel of this wine was produced. Although it's a 2016, the wine is a straw gold and seems well on the way to maturity. Ripe and tangy apples and pears abound, with a squirt of lemon juice. Drink now through 2018.
272640.title: Freja 2016 Albariño (Chehalem Mountains)
272640.location: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
272640.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Oregon and Canada.
Paul Gregutt is a Contributing Editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine, a founding member of the magazine’s Tasting Panel, and reviews the wines of Oregon and Canada. The author of the critically-acclaimed Washington Wines & Wineries—The Essential Guide, he consulted on the Pacific Northwest entries in current versions of The World Atlas of Wine and The Oxford Companion to Wine.
Email: paulgwine@me.com.

271848.description: This is a crisp, mineral-driven white wine from a Carneros-based producer with Spanish roots. White peach meets bright lemon on the balanced, succulent palate, resulting in an easy, accessible experience that's wholly enjoyable.
271848.title: Artesa 2016 Albariño (Los Carneros)
271848.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Contributing Editor Virginie Boone has been with Wine Enthusiast since 2010, and reviews the wines of Napa and Sonoma. Boone began her writing career with Lonely Planet travel guides, which eventually led to California-focused wine coverage. She contributes to the Santa Rosa Press Democrat and Sonoma Magazine, and is a regular panelist and speaker on wine topics in California and beyond.

 Email: vboone@wineenthusiast.net.

270794.description: Clean lines of grapefruit, lime and lemongrass make for a fresh, somewhat angular nose on this zesty tongue-tingling bottling. The palate begins with a round orange-candy flavor and then dives into the sharpness of lime skins and grapefruit peels, with a sizzle of acidity that goes long and deep.
270794.title: Brecon Estate 2016 Albariño (Central Coast)
270794.location: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
270794.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

270241.description: From the producer's estate site, in homage to her Spanish heritage, this white sizzles in varietal typicity, showing bright, forward notions of green apple, peach and a compelling wet-stone minerality that provides a gravelly edge to the texture. It lingers in honeysuckle.
270241.title: Marimar Estate 2016 Don Miguel Vineyard Albariño (Russian River Valley)
270241.location: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
270241.taster_description:

267135.title: Valmiñor 2016 Edición Especial 10 Años Albariño (Rías Baixas)
267135.taster_description:

270911.title: Fjord 2016 Albariño (Hudson River Region)
270911.location: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
270911.taster_description:

There is a lot of bouncy acidity to the palate that rides through riper Anjou pear and Gala apple flavors, with tart and tangy lime zest as well.

268313.title: Fillaboa 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

267170.title: Mar de Envero 2016 Troupe Albariño (Rías Baixas)

271272.description: Anselmo Mendes from granite Vinho Verde and Diogo Lopes from clay-soil Lisboa brought together the fruit of their harvests to make one limited-edition Alvarinho wine. The result: a ripe, warm and creamy character with wonderful fresh acidity. Drink this refreshing, ripe wine now.
271272.title: Adega Mãe 2015 2 2 1 Alvarinho (Portuguese Table Wine)
271272.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. 270844.description: Pure Alvarinho from the north of the Vinho Verde region makes this a smooth, ripe wine. It is perfumed, stylish and with a good balance between acidity and refreshing green and white fruitiness. Drink the wine now.
270844.title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Toucas Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
270844.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. With a smooth, ripe texture and layers of apple and citrus fruits, this is a concentrated wood-aged wine. The acidity is reminder of the cool climate of Portugal's Minho region. Drink from 2018.
271351.title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
271351.taster_description:

Aromas of fresh-cut apple and green papaya meet with a very stony minerality on the nose. The palate's powerful texture and sizzling acidity carry riper flavors of Gala apple and Anjou pear that continue deep into the finish.
266084.title: Mariposa 2016 Albariño (Edna Valley)
266084.location: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
266084.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.

Yeasty, lightly resiny flavors come with notes of briny citrus, while an oaky-tasting finish is steady due to the aforementioned acidity. Drink now.

265336.description: Light in color and mellow on the nose, with leesy notes, this always-reliable Albariño is fresh and kicking with acidity. Apple and peach flavors carry over to a plump finish with lasting stone-fruit and melon notes.
265336.title: As Laxas 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

266931.title: Terras Gauda 2016 Abadía de San Campio Albariño (Rías Baixas)

The flavors are light and crisp, with yellow apple and yellow-grapefruit pith most prominent.

266104.location: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US

259323.location: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
259323.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Jim Gordon has been covering the wine industry as an editor and reporter for more than 30 years. In 2006 he became editor of Wines & Vines, the media company for North American winemakers and grape growers. He directs the editorial content of Wines & Vines in the monthly print magazine, digital and social media. Gordon is also a contributing editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine and past director of the annual Symposium for Professional Wine Writers at Meadowood Napa Valley. He was editor in chief for two books by publisher Dorling Kindersley of London: Opus Vino, and 1000 Great Everyday Wines. Gordon was managing editor of Wine Spectator for 12 years, and editor in chief of Wine Country Living magazine for four, during which time he helped create Wine Country Living TV for NBC station KNTV in San Jose. He lives in Napa, California. Email: jgordon@wineenthusiast.net.

268759.location: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US

266239.description: A rich wood-aged wine, this is dense and creamy. With acidity and toast, ripe apples as well as spice, the wine is made to age. Coming from the Alvarinho heartland of Melgaço on Portugal's northern border, the wine has minerality and great intensity. It will be good until at least 2020.
266239.title: Quinta de Soalheiro 2015 Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
266239.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

266241.description: From the northern Vinho Verde region of Monçao and Melgaço, this finely textured wine is young, although already delicious. Its texture brings out the minerality from the granite soil, giving the wine a zesty character. The fruit bursts out of the glass: delicious citrus and sliced apples and a great burst of acidity. Drink from late 2017.
266241.title: Quinta de Soalheiro 2016 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
266241.taster_description:

263678.location: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
263678.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Washington and Idaho
In addition to his work at Wine Enthusiast, Sean P. Sullivan is the founder of Washington Wine Report, a site dedicated to the wines and wineries of the Pacific Northwest that has twice been named ‘Best Single Subject Wine Blog’ by the Wine Blog Awards. Sullivan has authored over 100 print articles on Northwest wine. He resides in Seattle, Washington.

262293.description: This strengthens the argument that there's a place for different kinds of white wines to be made in the Napa Valley, emphasizing fruit freshness and acidity without sacrificing flavor or soul. Juicy apricot and green apple ride a wave of unoaked refreshment and refinement, all within a crisp framework of deliciousness. Lavender and honeysuckle seduce quietly.
262293.title: Eighty Four 2016 Albariño (Napa Valley)
262293.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Contributing Editor Virginie Boone has been with Wine Enthusiast since 2010, and reviews the wines of Napa and Sonoma. Boone began her writing career with Lonely Planet travel guides, which eventually led to California-focused wine coverage. She contributes to the Santa Rosa Press Democrat and Sonoma Magazine, and is a regular panelist and speaker on wine topics in California and beyond.

 Email: vboone@wineenthusiast.net.

259262.description: The relatively cool climate of the Atlantic coast of Alentejo is very conducive to the Alvarinho with its northern roots. This is a refreshing crisp, nervy wine full of both acidity and citrus flavors. There is a more tropical hint at the back of the wine to add richness. Drink now.
259262.title: Cortes de Cima 2015 Alvarinho (Alentejano)
259262.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. There is compellingly grippy texture to the sip, with ripe flavors of pear and honeydew melon. A salty acidity takes it to the next level.
260582.title: Broken Earth 2015 Albariño (Paso Robles)
260582.location: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
260582.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

252774.description: Fleshy tropical aromas are mature and not that lively or kicking. In the mouth, this single-vineyard wine feels tight and acidic but also oily and full in body. Salty citrus and stone-fruit flavors are braced by core acidity, while this offers another helping of salty nectarine flavors on a full, dense finish. Drink now.

A grabby aged finish is short on the free flow that this grape and region are known for. Drink immediately or wait for a newer vintage.

Flavors of tart green apple and lime are racy almost to the point of being sour, while this ends with a tingle of sharp acidity and a sense of wet stones and minerals.
256113.title: Morgadío 2015 Legado del Conde Albariño Albariño (Rías Baixas)

250989.title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2015 Albariño (Sonoma Coast)
250989.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Contributing Editor Virginie Boone has been with Wine Enthusiast since 2010, and reviews the wines of Napa and Sonoma. Boone began her writing career with Lonely Planet travel guides, which eventually led to California-focused wine coverage. She contributes to the Santa Rosa Press Democrat and Sonoma Magazine, and is a regular panelist and speaker on wine topics in California and beyond.

 Email: vboone@wineenthusiast.net.

254262.description: Vines over 20 years old are seen as old vines for this wine. A ripe wine, it is full of tropical fruits, with a dense texture and intense green-fruit acidity. Mineral with balanced fruit, it will be ready to drink from mid-2017.
254262.title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 QM Vinhas Velhas Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
254262.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

252592.description: Citrus, mineral and honey aromas are good but not all that complex. This feels full and weighty, with nectarine and orange flavors. On the finish, dry citrus flavors are round and lasting but low on elegance. Drink now.

Creamy and full bodied, this benefits from bold malic acidity. Flavors of summer corn, dried apple and wood resin finish salty. Drink now with fish, crab or lobster.

252627.description: Oxidized apricot aromas comprise the bulk of the nose on this weird oak-aged Albariño. Flavors of apricot, peach pit and quince quickly turn bitter, while the finish is flabby. Overall this is sketchy, with few attributes.

250220.description: Fresh yellow pear, yellow grapefruit and wet river-stone aromas leap from the glass on this fresh and crisp bottling from a winery led by longtime grape grower Bill Kesselring. It's very textural on the tingling palate, where the vibrant mix of acid and tannins reveal sweet then tangy apple flavors before settling into a lime and lemon-rind groove.
250220.title: Peloton 2015 Spanish Springs Vineyard Albariño (San Luis Obispo)
250220.location: San Luis Obispo, Central Coast, California, US
250220.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival. 
Email: mkettmann@wineenthusiast.net.

250192.description: Made in barrels that have acacia wood on the heads, this bottling initially shows aromatic lemongrass and cut-grass greenness before offering riper peach, pear and almond oil on the nose. It tightens up on the sip, where tart apple skins, green pear and light honeysuckle flavors arise.
250192.title: Brecon Estate 2015 True Acacia Head Albariño (Central Coast)
250192.location: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
250192.taster_description:

244503.title: Artesa 2015 Albariño (Carneros)

250191.title: Brecon Estate 2015 Albariño (Central Coast)

250248.location: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US

249940.title: Nora 2015 Peitán Albariño (Rías Baixas)

250835.location: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
250835.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Washington and Idaho
In addition to his work at Wine Enthusiast, Sean P. Sullivan is the founder of Washington Wine Report, a site dedicated to the wines and wineries of the Pacific Northwest that has twice been named ‘Best Single Subject Wine Blog’ by the Wine Blog Awards. Sullivan has authored over 100 print articles on Northwest wine. He resides in Seattle, Washington.
Email: ssullivan@wineenthusiast.net.

244363.title: AlmaTerra 2015 Ponte Single Vineyard Albariño (Rías Baixas)

242970.description: Very smooth and quietly flavorful, this wine has more almond and vanilla notes than overt fruitiness, making it a subtle treat. It's full-bodied and soft on the palate, with good concentration.
242970.title: En Garde 2014 Vista Luna Vineyard Borden Ranch Albariño (Lodi)
242970.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Jim Gordon has been covering the wine industry as an editor and reporter for more than 30 years. In 2006 he became editor of Wines & Vines, the media company for North American winemakers and grape growers. He directs the editorial content of Wines & Vines in the monthly print magazine, digital and social media. Gordon is also a contributing editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine and past director of the annual Symposium for Professional Wine Writers at Meadowood Napa Valley. He was editor in chief for two books by publisher Dorling Kindersley of London: Opus Vino, and 1000 Great Everyday Wines. Gordon was managing editor of Wine Spectator for 12 years, and editor in chief of Wine Country Living magazine for four, during which time he helped create Wine Country Living TV for NBC station KNTV in San Jose. He lives in Napa, California. Email: jgordon@wineenthusiast.net.

250460.description: The Alvarinho grape, more at home in northern Portugal, makes a fine wine in the Alentejo hill country northeast of Lisbon. Here the flavors are tropical: ripe pineapple, a touch of spice and just the right amount of acidity. The wine will be better from 2017.
250460.title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Alvarinho (Alentejano)

243343.title: As Laxas 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

248650.description: This is a ripe, tangy wine. Skin contact before and during fermentation gives an extra richness while also preserving the crisp creaminess of the grape. The extra aging has produced a ripe wine that is ready to drink.
248650.title: Quinta de Santiago 2014 Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
248650.taster_description:
Roger Voss covers Bordeaux, Burgundy, Champagne, the Loire and South-West France as well as Portugal. His passion is matching food with wine, bringing the pleasures of the table to wine lovers. He has written six books on wine and food, and was previously national correspondent on wine for the London Daily Telegraph. He is based in the Bordeaux region.

Email: rvoss@wineenthusiast.net

242372.description: The floral and citrus-rind aromas are light, not yet fully showing themselves. The palate, in contrast brings a rich mouthfeel of fruit flavors, providing a lot of appeal.
242372.title: Idilico 2015 Albariño (Yakima Valley)
242372.location: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
242372.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Washington and Idaho
In addition to his work at Wine Enthusiast, Sean P. Sullivan is the founder of Washington Wine Report, a site dedicated to the wines and wineries of the Pacific Northwest that has twice been named ‘Best Single Subject Wine Blog’ by the Wine Blog Awards. Sullivan has authored over 100 print articles on Northwest wine. He resides in Seattle, Washington.
Email: ssullivan@wineenthusiast.net.

248306.description: A soft, creamy wine full of apple and pear fruits that are edged with crisp acidity. It is ripe, but still young; drink this attractive wine from 2017.
248306.title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Grand'Arte Alvarinho (Lisboa)
248306.taster_description:

243433.title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Nostalgia Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

243441.title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

244996.title: Niner 2015 Albariño (Edna Valley)
244996.location: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
244996.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
A fifth generation Californian originally from San Jose, Matt Kettmann covers California’s Central Coast and South Coast for the magazine. He is also the senior editor of The Santa Barbara Independent, where he’s worked since 1999, has written for the New York Times, Time Magazine, Wine Spectator, and Smithsonian, and co-founded New Noise Santa Barbara, a music festival.

243614.description: From vineyards in the southern section of Vinho Verde, this ripe Alvarinho is soft and fruity. It has a light texture that is balanced with crisp acidity and a juicy, perfumed aftertaste. Drink this wine now.

240864.title: Aveleda 2015 Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

243495.description: A ripe, creamy wine with fine fruit and soft acidity, this is delicious wine to drink now. It has apple and ripe pear fruits along with bright acidity to keep it all fresh. The aftertaste is smooth with just a light tang.
243495.title: Obrigado 2015 Nortico Alvarinho (Minho)
243495.taster_description:

243801.description: Grapefruit scents and flavors dominate this tasty wine. Some will find it identifies more closely with something akin to New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc, rather than a seasalty Albariño from Spain. No matter: It's fresh and zippy and best enjoyed within a couple years of the vintage.
243801.title: Abacela 2015 Albariño (Umpqua Valley)
243801.location: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
243801.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Oregon and Canada.
Paul Gregutt is a Contributing Editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine, a founding member of the magazine’s Tasting Panel, and reviews the wines of Oregon and Canada. The author of the critically-acclaimed Washington Wines & Wineries—The Essential Guide, he consulted on the Pacific Northwest entries in current versions of The World Atlas of Wine and The Oxford Companion to Wine.
Email: paulgwine@me.com.

243539.description: This is a really crisp version of Alvarinho, emphasizing a lemon and lime character. It is fruity with a strong texture of minerality and just a splash of apple juice at the end. Drink now.
243539.title: Quinta de Gomariz 2015 Colheita Seleccionada Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

241163.description: Canned fruit—both peach and pineapple—show good depth against a slightly smoky backdrop. Round and silky on the palate, there's a balance of acid to give brightness.
241163.title: McPherson 2015 Castaño Prado Vineyards Albariño (Texas)
241163.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Italy and New York.

Formerly working in the Finger Lakes wine region of upstate New York, Peartree's passion for terroir-expressive products, which spans from wine to cider and tea, is only rivaled by his love of canoeing and hiking. On top of enjoying wines from the region where his wine career began, he can often be caught drinking Old World selections from his central and southern Italian beats.

 Email: apeartree@wineenthusiast.net.

243555.description: A 100% Alvarinho wine grown outside its classic area in the north of Vinho Verde, this one earns the Minho regional designation. This wine is in a light style, fruity with green plums and tangy with orange peel. Drink now.
243555.title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Dom Diogo Colheita Seleccionada Alvarinho (Minho)

243431.description: Alvarinho from the north of the Vinho Verde gives a ripe, creamy textured wine that also has a cool feel to it. It is juicy, with a fine floral character as well as ripe lemon and apple flavors. Drink this wine now.
243431.title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Toucas Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

243358.title: Viniverde 2015 Estreia Reserva Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

243357.title: Viniverde 2015 Estreia Colheita Seleccionafa Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

241161.description: Peachy, floral aromas are friendly and clean. This blend of mostly Albariño and some Caiño Blanco and Loureira is round on the palate, with ample volume. Appealing flavors of melon, peach and apple finish dry and with a hint of white pepper. Wines like this are why almost everyone loves Albariño from Rías Baixas.

241161.taster_description:
Reviews wines from Argentina, Chile and Spain.
Michael Schachner is a New York-based journalist specializing in wine, food and travel. His articles appear regularly in Wine Enthusiast, where he is a longstanding contributing editor responsible for South America and Spain. Schachner reviews more than 2,000 wines annually for WE and regularly travels to Chile, Argentina and Spain to keep abreast of the constantly changing global wine map.

240738.description: Tight, citrusy aromas suggest mostly orange and tangerine. This is fresh and clean in an appealing but easy way. Peach and melon flavors are friendly, while the finish is crisp, stony and maintains the wine's tasty core flavors.
240738.title: Maior de Mendoza 2015 On Lees Albariño (Rías Baixas)

232797.description: This medium-bodied, unoaked wine smells peachy and melony, has a smooth texture and good, fresh flavors. A crisp character keeps it tasting tangy.
232797.title: Oak Farm 2015 Albariño (Lodi)
232797.taster_description:
Reviews wines from California.
Jim Gordon has been covering the wine industry as an editor and reporter for more than 30 years. In 2006 he became editor of Wines & Vines, the media company for North American winemakers and grape growers. He directs the editorial content of Wines & Vines in the monthly print magazine, digital and social media. Gordon is also a contributing editor for Wine Enthusiast magazine and past director of the annual Symposium for Professional Wine Writers at Meadowood Napa Valley. He was editor in chief for two books by publisher Dorling Kindersley of London: Opus Vino, and 1000 Great Everyday Wines. Gordon was managing editor of Wine Spectator for 12 years, and editor in chief of Wine Country Living magazine for four, during which time he helped create Wine Country Living TV for NBC station KNTV in San Jose. He lives in Napa, California. Email: jgordon@wineenthusiast.net.

233477.description: Bright and tangy, this light-bodied wine smells fresh and herbal, almost like celery, and tastes very vibrant. It will be especially tasty in hot weather.
233477.title: Klinker Brick 2015 Albariño (Lodi)
233477.taster_description:

240881.title: Altos de Torona 2013 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

242407.title: Zarate 2015 Albariño (Rías Baixas)

242337.description: Aromas of Sherry and barrel resin are all you get from this wood-fermented, oxidized number. While neither foul nor severe, the all-wood nature of this is overly dominant and not pleasant enough to stand on its own.
242337.title: Attis 2013 Nana Albariño (Rías Baixas)

241461.title: Bodegas Aquitania 2014 Bernon Albariño (Rías Baixas)
241461.taster_description:
